contentrichtext.text: {{other uses}} {{Infobox musical artist | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject Musicians --> | name = ZYX<br>ZYX-α | image = ZYX, 2003 promotional photo.jpg | caption = ZYX, 2003.<br>Back row (L to R): Erika Umeda, Mari Yaguchi, Maimi Yajima<br>Front row (L to R): Saki Shimizu, Megumi Murakami, Momoko Tsugunaga. | background = group_or_band | alias = Zicks | origin = [[Japan]] | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | years_active = 2003–2009<br>2009–present | label = [[Piccolo Town]] | associated_acts = [[Morning Musume]]<br />[[Hello! Project Kids]]<br />[[Aa!]]<br />[[Berryz Koubou]]<br />[[Cute (Japanese band)|Cute]]<br />[[Hello! Pro Egg]] | website = [http://www.helloproject.com Hello! Project.com] | current_members = [[Momoko Tsugunaga]]<br>[[Chinami Tokunaga]]<br>[[Maasa Sudou]]<br>[[Ayaka Wada]] | past_members = [[Mari Yaguchi]]<br>[[Saki Shimizu]]<br>[[Maimi Yajima]]<br>[[Megumi Murakami]]<br>[[Erika Umeda]]<br>[[Koharu Kusumi]]<br>[[Saki Ogawa]]<br> [[Risa Niigaki]] }} {{nihongo|'''ZYX'''|ジックス|Jikkusu|extra=pronounced ''zicks''}} was a short-lived [[Japan]]ese [[Pop music|pop]] group made up of five [[Hello! Project Kids]] members led by [[Mari Yaguchi]] of [[Morning Musume]]. Yaguchi acted as a mentor and the group released two singles. ZYX is important in that it is the first unit that Hello! Project Kids officially joined with the second being [[Aa!]] formed in 2003, the third being [[Berryz Kobo]] in 2004, and the fourth being [[Cute (Japanese band)|Cute]] in 2005. As [[Saki Shimizu]] and [[Momoko Tsugunaga]] were selected to become members of Berryz Kobo in 2004, the activity of ZYX virtually ended. The name ZYX is a kind of [[acronym]] using a somewhat intricate play in notation. "Z" and "Y" are taken from the phrase {{nihongo|''"'''Z'''ettai '''Y'''ume o Bai ni."''|絶対、夢を倍に|We hope that you will definitely accomplish your dreams double in size.}} "Bai ni", meaning "[to accomplish] double in size", is represented not as "B" but as a multiplication mark "×" which was then identified with letter "'''X'''" in its formal resemblance. Also, it is strongly conscious that the letters ZYX are the last letters of the English alphabet in reverse order. In [[Hello! Project]], this inverted order naming is followed by the groups "[[W (Double You)|W]]" created in 2004, "[[v-u-den]]" in 2005, "[[The Possible (group)|The Possible]]" in 2006 and SI☆NA in 2008. This line-up of groups continues the reverse alphabetical naming (ZYX-W-VU-T-S). In 2009, the unit was revived as '''ZYX-α''' (ZYX Alpha). Of all the original members, only Momoko Tsugunaga remains (Mari Yaguchi, Megumi Murakami and Erika Umeda are no longer a part of Hello! Project and Saki Shimizu and Maimi Yajima are a part of [[High-King]]). == Members == === ZYX === * [[Mari Yaguchi]] (Leader) * [[Erika Umeda]] * [[Saki Shimizu]] * [[Maimi Yajima]] * [[Momoko Tsugunaga]] * [[Megumi Murakami]] === ZYX-α === * [[Risa Niigaki]] (Leader) (graduated May 2012) * [[Momoko Tsugunaga]] * [[Chinami Tokunaga]] * [[Maasa Sudo]] * [[Koharu Kusumi]] (graduated December 2009) * [[Ayaka Wada]] * [[Saki Ogawa]] (graduated August 2011) == Discography == === Singles === {| class="wikitable" cellpadding="3" ! # !! Title !! Release date !! Coupling |- | 1 || {{nihongo|[[Iku ZYX! Fly High]]|行くZYX! Fly High||"Go ZYX! Fly High"}} ||align="right"|2003-08-06 | {{nihongo|Gatamekira ZYX ver.|ガタメキラ||"Gotta Make it Love"}} |- | 2 || {{nihongo|[[Shiroi Tokyo]]|白いTOKYO|White Tokyo}} ||align="right"|2003-12-10 | {{nihongo|Tokonatsu-Musume ZYX ver.|常夏娘||"Endless Summer Girls"}} |} === DVDs === {| class="wikitable" cellpadding="3" ! # !! Title !! Release date |- | 1 || {{nihongo|Single V: Iku ZYX! Fly High|シングルV・行くZYX! Fly High}} ||align="right"|2003-09-10 |- | 2 || {{nihongo|Single V: Shiroi Tokyo|シングルV・白いTOKYO}} ||align="right"|2003-12-26 |} == External links == *[http://www.up-front-works.jp/discography/piccolotown/03/list.html ZYX discography at Up-Front Works] {{Hello!
